snippet: The sea is its own cosmos, and whatever meaning we can ascribe to the universe arose in its depths, the mysterious caldron of creativity and possibility, the restless sifting of chance, adaptation, survival and extinction.
abstract: Dennis Overbye Out There column describes how his childhood dream of space travel led him to pursue scuba diving instead; draws parallels between the cosmos of the sky and the cosmos of the ocean depths, noting that Big Bang spawned them both.
lead_paragraph: The sea is its own cosmos, and whatever meaning we can ascribe to the universe arose in its depths, the mysterious caldron of creativity and possibility, the restless sifting of chance, adaptation, survival and extinction.

headline.print_headline: Cosmic Connections in the Deep Sea
headline.main: Cosmic Connections in the Deep Sea
